title: Mother & Child
caption: I wanted to keep souvenirs of my work in refugee camps. This is how I started to paint - by painting portraits of refugees. Their image exuded such strength, in surroundings that offered such sorrow. And it gave me a lot of challenge and inspiration.

venue: Ruper Gallery, Canton De Vaud, Switzerland
title: Pastis ou PÃ©tanque
caption: I often found myself waiting, so I started doing a series of people waiting in cafes, metro, trains.

venue: Centre des Artes de Maputo, Mozambique
title: Wild in Kruger Park
caption: After the war in Mozambique, the borders were open, the Mozambicans were so happy to travel in neighboring countries.

title: My Life in Maputo
caption: There's a brighter side of Mozambique and I was inspired to do this series of paintings in acrylic and gouache. And this was all about the positive life in Mozambique. In spite of what the country has gone through, there were Jazz music, dancing, so lively and life goes on.

title: Where Do I Belong?
caption: My days in Mozambique immersed me in a world where the color of one's skin instantly stratifies him/her in a class. This painting depicts the stress, anguish and confusion one feels when caged in such a world.

venue: The French Cultural Center, Maputo Mozambique
title: Swaziland Here We Come
caption: This was my interpretation of how Africans celebrated their independence.

title: Harvest Time
caption: This was about two sisters Ivatans (natives of Batanes, Philippines) sharing their lunch after a hard days' work, It's one of my favorite paintings as it reminded me of my sisters

title: Batanes et Provence
caption: This was a series of paintings that I wanted to show that Batanes is just as beautiful as Provence, France. It is at this point that people are astounded by the similarities and then begin to realize that this distant beauty they seek may not be too distant at all.

venue: Carqueiranne Bibliothèque, South of France, France
title: The Door
details: 120x90 cm, Gold Paper on Rice Paper, Natural Pigment, Oil on Canvas
caption: After trying several media, from oil,acrylic, gouache, watercolor, pastel, charcoal, I finally found my own technique,which I would like to share,that using Asian materials with natural pigment mixed with oil, on canvas or linen, establishes my identity.And since then from 2003 up to present. I never stop creating.and always want to promote materials coming from Asia.

venue: Comptoir du chocolat, Divonne les Bains, France
title: My Life
details: 20x20 cm, Natural Pigment, Point heating on Rice Paper
caption: I wanted to have my identity as an Asian by integrating Asian materials in my painting. Like rice paper, gold paper, banana stalks, bamboo leaves, batik… … and this is where my imagination begins.
